message: I think you should just rename this to threads don't increase performance. Even in the none [Asp.net](http://Asp.net) example the code will be slower on a single core processor. It seams to me this is just for people that don't understand multithreading and has nothing to do with tasks. Threads by definition decrease performance so I don't understand what why would it be a surprise that this is the case with Task.Run. Making things parallel is what increases the performance. But I am more interested if this is really that big of a performance downfall or is it in reality a micro optimization.
